summary: In this context, 1,1,2,2-tetrachloroethene is mentioned as one of the volatile organic compounds (VOCs) detected in water samples from various rivers and lakes. The analysis indicates that this compound, along with others, was found in the water specimens, suggesting potential contamination of aquatic environments. However, there is no detailed discussion of the specific effects or interactions of 1,1,2,2-tetrachloroethene with the water specimens beyond its presence as a detected contaminant.
